createPayment.name: createPayment
createPayment.summary: Once you have created a payment, you should redirect your customer to the URL in the $payment['_links']['checkout']['href']

doc.description:
Once you have created a payment, you should redirect your customer to the URL in the $payment['_links']['checkout']['href']

https://docs.mollie.com/reference/v2/payments-api/create-payment

createPayment.comments:
/**
   * Once you have created a payment, you should redirect your customer to the URL in the $payment['_links']['checkout']['href']
   *
   * https://docs.mollie.com/reference/v2/payments-api/create-payment
   *
   * @param array $data
   * @param string|null $mandate_id
   * @return array
   * @throws \Mollie\Api\Exceptions\ApiException
   */

createPaymentFirstTime.name: createPaymentFirstTime
createPaymentFirstTime.summary: Create a payment for the first time for the user.
createPaymentFirstTime.description:
Once you have created a payment, you should redirect your customer to the URL in the $payment['_links']['checkout']['href']

This will return the `customerId` and `mandateId` in the response.

description_parts.content:
Once you have created a payment, you should redirect your customer to the URL in the $payment['_links']['checkout']['href']

This will return the `customerId` and `mandateId` in the response.

doc.description:
Create a payment for the first time for the user.
Once you have created a payment, you should redirect your customer to the URL in the $payment['_links']['checkout']['href']

This will return the `customerId` and `mandateId` in the response.

createPaymentFirstTime.comments:
/**
   * Create a payment for the first time for the user.
   * Once you have created a payment, you should redirect your customer to the URL in the $payment['_links']['checkout']['href']
   *
   * This will return the `customerId` and `mandateId` in the response.
   *
   * @param array $customer_data
   * @param array $payment_data
   * @return array
   * @throws \Mollie\Api\Exceptions\ApiException
   */

revokeMandate.name: revokeMandate
revokeMandate.description:
You will no longer be able to charge the consumer’s bank account or credit card
with this mandate and all connected subscriptions will be canceled.

https://docs.mollie.com/reference/v2/mandates-api/revoke-mandate

description_parts.content:
You will no longer be able to charge the consumer’s bank account or credit card
with this mandate and all connected subscriptions will be canceled.

https://docs.mollie.com/reference/v2/mandates-api/revoke-mandate

doc.description:
Revoke a customer’s mandate.

You will no longer be able to charge the consumer’s bank account or credit card
with this mandate and all connected subscriptions will be canceled.

https://docs.mollie.com/reference/v2/mandates-api/revoke-mandate

revokeMandate.comments:
/**
   * Revoke a customer’s mandate.
   *
   * You will no longer be able to charge the consumer’s bank account or credit card
   * with this mandate and all connected subscriptions will be canceled.
   *
   * https://docs.mollie.com/reference/v2/mandates-api/revoke-mandate
   *
   * @param string $customer_id
   * @param string $mandate_id
   * @param array $params
   * @return void
   * @throws \Mollie\Api\Exceptions\ApiException
   */

listPayments.name: listPayments
listPayments.summary: Retrieve all payments created ordered from newest to oldest.
listPayments.description:
This will list all payments not only the paid ones
so when looping through results you can check if a payment is paid:

description_parts.content:
This will list all payments not only the paid ones
so when looping through results you can check if a payment is paid:

arguments.name: from
arguments.description: Used for pagination. Offset the result set to the payment with this ID. The payment with this ID is included in the result set as well.

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: The number of payments to return (with a maximum of 250).

params.name: $from
params.description: Used for pagination. Offset the result set to the payment with this ID. The payment with this ID is included in the result set as well.

params.name: $limit
params.description: The number of payments to return (with a maximum of 250).
